question: What is the scope of this LEM/TEK/18 Sem.3 document limited to as a guide for?
options: License holders regarding license applications
Radiation Protection Officers (RPO) regarding the recognition and duties of RPOs
Radiation workers regarding work procedures
Training agencies accredited by AELB
answer: Radiation Protection Officers (RPO) regarding the recognition and duties of RPOs

question: What is the definition of a 'Radiation Protection Officer (RPO)'?
options: Any person working under the direction of the license holder
A technically competent person appointed by the employer only
A technically competent person appointed by the license holder and approved by the Board to supervise the application of appropriate radiation protection regulations, measures, and procedures
The holder of a license issued under the Atomic Energy Licensing Act 1984 (Act 304)
answer: A technically competent person appointed by the license holder and approved by the Board to supervise the application of appropriate radiation protection regulations, measures, and procedures

question: According to Regulation 16(1), Atomic Energy Licensing (Basic Safety Radiation Protection) Regulations 2010 [P.U.(A)46], what is the legal requirement regarding RPOs?
options: The RPO must attend a refresher course every year
The license holder must employ a Radiation Protection Officer (RPO)
The RPO must be an operator accredited by AELB
The license holder must submit a formal application online to AELB
answer: The license holder must employ a Radiation Protection Officer (RPO)

question: What is one of the criteria and conditions for RPO recognition?
options: Has served for a minimum of 5 years in the related field
Holds a Bachelor's Degree in Physics
Attends a course for RPOs at a training agency accredited by AELB
Does not need to sit for the RPO Certification Examination
answer: Attends a course for RPOs at a training agency accredited by AELB

question: For recognition purposes, how must the RPO submit a formal application to AELB?
options: Manually via registered mail
Via email to the Director of the Policy and External Relations Division
Online (on-line) to AELB through the eLicense system
Through the license holder's legal representative
answer: Online (on-line) to AELB through the eLicense system

question: What is one of the RPO's duties concerning the Radiation Protection Program, Security Plan, and Emergency Plan?
options: Ensuring it is approved by the Atomic Energy Licensing Board (AELB) only
Outlining a Radiation Protection Program, Security Plan, and Emergency Plan (if applicable) appropriate to the activities conducted by their employer
Making amendments to the Radiation Protection Program without consulting the employer
Testing the effectiveness of the Security Plan every two years
answer: Outlining a Radiation Protection Program, Security Plan, and Emergency Plan (if applicable) appropriate to the activities conducted by their employer

question: What is the maximum duration for RPO recognition?
options: 1 year
2 years
3 years
5 years
answer: 3 years

question: What is another condition for the RPO recognition period besides the maximum duration of 3 years?
options: Subject to the results of the latest RPO Certification Examination
Subject to the results of the annual medical examination
Subject to the number of Continuous Education Programme (CEP) points obtained
Subject to re-recognition by the employer
answer: Subject to the number of Continuous Education Programme (CEP) points obtained

question: What must be approved by AELB first before being used for the purpose of keeping and storing radioactive material, nuclear material, or prescribed substances?
options: Radiation monitoring equipment
Proposed work procedures
Storage facility
Medical surveillance records
answer: Storage facility

question: Why must the RPO check, keep, and update the 'Radiation worker exposure record' document?
options: For financial record purposes only
To monitor acceptable practices and ensure that exposure is as low as reasonably achievable (ALARA) for every worker
To comply with established security measures
To record external radiation exposure levels at the storage site
answer: To monitor acceptable practices and ensure that exposure is as low as reasonably achievable (ALARA) for every worker

question: The RPO must ensure that the transport of radioactive material, nuclear material, or prescribed substances is carried out according to what?
options: World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines
Radiation Protection (Transport) Regulations 1989
Occupational Safety and Health Act 1994
Atomic Energy Licensing (Basic Safety Radiation Protection) Regulations 2010
answer: Radiation Protection (Transport) Regulations 1989

question: What is one of the qualifications required of an RPO concerning ionising radiation?
options: Has basic knowledge of radiation protection
Has adequate knowledge of the characteristics of ionising radiation used in the work undertaken by the license holder
Sits for and passes at least Level 1 of the Industrial Radiography course
Has knowledge of radiation exposure history
answer: Has adequate knowledge of the characteristics of ionising radiation used in the work undertaken by the license holder

question: When did Regulation 16, Atomic Energy Licensing (Basic Safety Radiation Protection) Regulations 2010 [P.U.(A)46] come into force?
options: November 9, 2017
Not stated in the document
The year 2010
answer: The year 2010

question: What must the license holder do for the appointed RPO to carry out their duties and responsibilities?
options: Provide a special allowance
Supervise their every action
Grant full authority
Only consider their advice
answer: Grant full authority

question: For the field of industrial radiography, the RPO must be what, as accredited by AELB?
options: Radiation Supervisor
Laboratory Technician
Operator
Safety and Health Officer
answer: Operator

question: What must the RPO report if there is any unforeseen incident that threatens the element of security?
options: To the police only
To the employer within 48 hours
Report any unforeseen incident that threatens the element of security within 24 hours from the time of the related incident
No requirement to report
answer: Report any unforeseen incident that threatens the element of security within 24 hours from the time of the related incident

question: What is meant by 'radiation equipment'?
options: Only irradiation apparatus
Radiation source (irradiation apparatus or material capable of emitting ionising radiation) and other apparatus needed to complete the equipment
Any apparatus that can emit non-ionising radiation
Radiation detection devices and personal monitoring equipment
answer: Radiation source (irradiation apparatus or material capable of emitting ionising radiation) and other apparatus needed to complete the equipment

question: What is one of the records related to medical surveillance that must be properly kept and maintained by the RPO?
options: Records of movement/transport of radioactive material
Medical surveillance conducted related to the history of radiation exposure for all workers
Records of sealed source leak tests
Training/course records
answer: Medical surveillance conducted related to the history of radiation exposure for all workers

question: What action must the RPO take if a worker is found to be in breach of the provisions of Act 304?
options: Issue a written warning notice to the worker
Report to AELB for disciplinary action
Stop the operation of the radiation equipment
Impose a fine on the worker
answer: Stop the operation of the radiation equipment

question: What records regarding radiation workers must be updated by the RPO?
options: Records of PPE purchases
Records of Emergency Plan testing
Records of the recruitment, cessation, or transfer of radiation workers
Records of external radiation exposure levels
answer: Records of the recruitment, cessation, or transfer of radiation workers

question: What is one of the RPO's duties related to training?
options: Cancel training for absent workers
Plan appropriate training and retraining for all workers dealing with ionising radiation
Conduct training themselves without involving training agencies
Ensure all workers pass the training examination
answer: Plan appropriate training and retraining for all workers dealing with ionising radiation

question: The RPO must classify and label work areas according to what?
options: ICRP (International Commission on Radiological Protection) guidelines
Atomic Energy Licensing (Basic Safety Radiation Protection) Regulations 2010 [P.U.(A)46]
ISO 9001 Quality Standard
Industrial safety guidelines
answer: Atomic Energy Licensing (Basic Safety Radiation Protection) Regulations 2010 [P.U.(A)46]

question: What must the RPO ensure regarding workers working in a controlled area?
options: They are supplied with food supplements
They are supplied with personal monitoring equipment to record the occupational exposure received
They attend all safety meetings
They have the latest certificate of competency
answer: They are supplied with personal monitoring equipment to record the occupational exposure received

question: What action must the RPO take if an unusual condition or abnormal exposure occurs?
options: Investigate the condition and report it to AELB within 24 hours
Only prepare a specific record about it
Report to the employer within 30 days
Establish procedures for dealing with any unusual condition
answer: Investigate the condition and report it to AELB within 24 hours

question: What must be prepared and submitted to AELB within 30 days after the occurrence of an unusual incident?
options: A copy of the medical examination record
A specific record regarding the unusual condition or abnormal exposure
Notice of cessation of operational activities
AELB inspection visit report
answer: A specific record regarding the unusual condition or abnormal exposure

question: What is one of the records that must be managed by the RPO regarding radiation equipment?
options: Records of temporary placement of radiation equipment
Records of maintenance of radiation equipment
Records of the cost of purchasing radiation equipment
Records of warranty of radiation equipment
answer: Records of maintenance of radiation equipment

question: What must the RPO ensure regarding the Statement of ownership of radiation equipment?
options: Prepare the Statement of Ownership of radiation equipment (LPTA/BM/3)
Prepare the Statement of Sale of radiation equipment (LPTA/BM/2)
Keep and update the said record
Submit the statement every month
answer: Keep and update the said record

question: What is the RPO's duty concerning the security of radioactive sources and the license holder's facilities?
options: Ensuring it is always protected by licensed Security Guards
Ensuring the security of radioactive sources and the license holder's facilities is constantly monitored to prevent any risk of loss, sabotage, or theft
Ensuring all radiation workers are given security training
Ensuring only the RPO has access to radioactive sources
answer: Ensuring the security of radioactive sources and the license holder's facilities is constantly monitored to prevent any risk of loss, sabotage, or theft

question: What is meant by 'employer' according to the definition in this document?
options: Only the Chief Executive Officer of the company
Any person who has entered into a contract of service with an employee and includes a manager, agent, occupier or owner of a place of work, legal representative, and any statutory body
Only the license holder
Any person responsible for the payment of salaries or wages only
answer: Any person who has entered into a contract of service with an employee and includes a manager, agent, occupier or owner of a place of work, legal representative, and any statutory body

question: What must the RPO do regarding any proposed change in the location of radiation equipment?
options: Only inform the employer
Inform AELB first
Inform all radiation workers
Only record it in the maintenance log
answer: Inform AELB first

question: What must the RPO ensure regarding radiation hazard warning signs?
options: Appropriate radiation hazard warning signs are available, displayed when necessary, and removed when no longer needed
Warning signs only need to be displayed in the controlled area
Radiation hazard warning signs must be updated monthly
Radiation hazard warning signs are only required for the storage area
answer: Appropriate radiation hazard warning signs are available, displayed when necessary, and removed when no longer needed

question: What must the RPO test the effectiveness of?
options: Operation of radiation equipment
Proposed work procedures
Security Plan and Emergency Plan
Personal monitoring equipment
answer: Security Plan and Emergency Plan

question: What is one of the records related to disposal that must be checked and kept by the RPO?
options: Records of disposal of ordinary solid waste
Records of disposal of hazardous chemicals
Records of disposal of radiation equipment
Records of disposal of confidential documents
answer: Records of disposal of radiation equipment

question: The RPO must fully implement and test the Security Plan and Emergency Plan approved by AELB, and what is the next action?
options: Report to the Radiation Protection Committee only
Document the implementation report
Store the Plan in a safe place
Revoke the license if the test fails
answer: Document the implementation report

question: What is the act under which a license is issued to the license holder?
options: Occupational Safety and Health Act 1994
Atomic Energy Licensing Act 1984 (Act 304)
Environmental Quality Act 1974
Local Government Act 1976
answer: Atomic Energy Licensing Act 1984 (Act 304)

question: What is the RPO's duty concerning the Statement of sale of radiation equipment?
options: Keep and update the Statement of Sale of radiation equipment (LPTA/BM/2)
Only send a copy to the buyer
Cancel the sale if it does not comply with the conditions
Prepare a monthly sales statement
answer: Keep and update the Statement of Sale of radiation equipment (LPTA/BM/2)

question: What must be established and complied with by the RPO for activities involving unsealed radioactive material?
options: A work procedure that requires more frequent medical surveillance
A work procedure that requires more expensive PPE
A work procedure shall be established which makes contamination unlikely
A work procedure involving the use of radiation protection safety devices
answer: A work procedure shall be established which makes contamination unlikely

question: Who must be appointed by the license holder to supervise the application of appropriate radiation protection regulations, measures, and procedures?
options: A Project Manager
A Safety Officer
A Civil Engineer
A Radiation Protection Officer (RPO)
answer: A Radiation Protection Officer (RPO)

question: What must the RPO do regarding all proposed work procedures (including new projects or changes to existing ones)?
options: Only check AELB approval
Conduct a review
Report to the local authority
Implement the Emergency Plan
answer: Conduct a review

question: What is one condition for an RPO in the Sale and Trade activity for the field of industrial radiography?
options: Must pass the Industrial Radiography Examination Level 2
Must attend the Industrial Radiography course (minimum Level 1) without needing to sit for the Industrial Radiography Examination
Does not need to attend any course
Must be accredited as an Operator by AELB
answer: Must attend the Industrial Radiography course (minimum Level 1) without needing to sit for the Industrial Radiography Examination

question: What is one of the records related to the transport of radioactive material that must be kept by the RPO?
options: Records of transport toll fees
Records of Security Plan testing
Records of movement/transport of radioactive material
Records of maintenance of radiation equipment
answer: Records of movement/transport of radioactive material

question: What records related to equipment testing must be managed by the RPO?
options: Records of fuel quality testing
Records of sealed source leak tests
Records of water quality testing
Records of sound level testing
answer: Records of sealed source leak tests

question: What are the medical examination records of radiation workers (Section A) and the radiation worker exposure records (Section B) that must be managed by the RPO?
options: LPTA/BM/5 (Section A) and LPTA/BM/5 (Section B)
LPTA/BM/3 and LPTA/BM/2
LEM/TEK/44 (Part A)
Notification Notice No. 03/ 2017
answer: LPTA/BM/5 (Section A) and LPTA/BM/5 (Section B)

question: In the context of dealing with radioactive material, what does 'urusan' (business/activity) mean?
options: Only buying and selling

Any activity involving such radioactive material, nuclear material, prescribed substances, or irradiation apparatus that is manufactured, traded, produced, processed, purchased, possessed, used, transported, transferred, handled, sold, stored, imported, or exported
Only transport and storage
Only production and disposal
answer: Any activity involving such radioactive material, nuclear material, prescribed substances, or irradiation apparatus that is manufactured, traded, produced, processed, purchased, possessed, used, transported, transferred, handled, sold, stored, imported, or exported

question: What must the RPO ensure regarding exposure time, distance, and shielding?
options: Used only for activities involving unsealed radioactive material
Used in areas where external radiation hazards may exist
Used only for Trainee Operators
Used only for the Emergency Plan
answer: Used in areas where external radiation hazards may exist

question: What is the reference related to the Radiation Protection Officer Certification Standard?
options: LEM/TEK/44 (Part A)
Notification Notice No. 01/2014
LEM/TEK/18 Sem.3
Radiation Protection (Transport) Regulations 1989
answer: LEM/TEK/44 (Part A)

question: What must the RPO do with the radiological safety survey?
options: Keep it as a confidential document
Bring it to the knowledge of the license holder, other responsible persons, and the Radiation Protection Committee (if any)
Submit it to AELB for approval
Used for training and retraining purposes
answer: Bring it to the knowledge of the license holder, other responsible persons, and the Radiation Protection Committee (if any)

question: What must the RPO do with the procedure for the disposal of any radioactive waste?
options: Must be established and complied with, and submitted to AELB for approval
Must be established and complied with by the employer only
Established after receiving AELB approval
Used for the purpose of the Statement of ownership of radiation equipment
answer: Must be established and complied with, and submitted to AELB for approval

question: Who conducts the RPO Certification Examination under the RPO Certification Scheme?
options: Atomic Energy Licensing Board (AELB)
National RPO Certification Committee (JKPPPS)
Training agencies accredited by AELB
Ministry of Science Technology & Innovation
answer: National RPO Certification Committee (JKPPPS)

question: What is one of the records related to ionising radiation that must be managed by the RPO?
options: Records of accounting for radioactive material
Vehicle maintenance records
Records of worker competency testing
Records of office furniture purchases
answer: Records of accounting for radioactive material

question: What must the RPO do concerning area and personal monitoring equipment?
options: Calibrate every 5 years.
Ensure they are functioning well and calibrated.
Kept in a safe place without needing calibration.
Only used during an emergency.
answer: Ensure they are functioning well and calibrated.

question: What is the License Holder's responsibility to the RPO?
options: Grant permission to appoint a second RPO.
Provide relevant information to enable the RPO to carry out duties.
Determine the RPO's scope of work.
Approve the RPO's training program.
answer: Provide relevant information to enable the RPO to carry out duties.

question: What must the RPO manage concerning the inventory of radioactive material?
options: Prepare annual purchase records only.
Ensure the inventory of radioactive material is constantly updated.
Report inventory to the employer every 6 months.
Update the inventory only when a loss occurs.
answer: Ensure the inventory of radioactive material is constantly updated.

question: When did this LEM/TEK/18 Sem.3 guidance document apply?
options: April 7, 2014.
September 1989.
November 9, 2017.
Immediately upon ministerial approval.
answer: November 9, 2017.

question: What must the RPO do if a situation arises that could cause radiation exposure to exceed the permissible limit?
options: Continue operation with stricter monitoring.
Consult with the Radiation Protection Committee.
Take immediate steps to rectify the situation and ensure operations involving radiation exposure are stopped.
Report to AELB after 7 days.
answer: Take immediate steps to rectify the situation and ensure operations involving radiation exposure are stopped.

question: What is meant by 'radiation worker'?
options: A worker involved in any activity using radioactive material.
An employee certified by the Head of the Department/Centre and formally accredited by AELB.
Any worker who has been appointed as an RPO.
A worker who holds a license under Act 304.
answer: An employee certified by the Head of the Department/Centre and formally accredited by AELB.

question: What must the RPO maintain regarding radiation protection devices and safety equipment?
options: Keep records of purchase and price.
Ensure they are maintained and functioning well.
Prepare a damage report to AELB.
Ensure only radiation workers use them.
answer: Ensure they are maintained and functioning well.

question: What must the RPO prepare for workers who cease employment?
options: Certificate of appreciation.
Final radiation dose record.
Complete medical report.
Letter of release of responsibility.
answer: Final radiation dose record.

question: What is the RPO's role concerning the Security Plan?
options: Ensure the Security Plan is complied with by the public.
Prepare and update the Security Plan when necessary and as directed by AELB.
Provide financial allocation for the Security Plan.
Approve any amendment to the Security Plan.
answer: Prepare and update the Security Plan when necessary and as directed by AELB.

question: How many Continuing Education Programme (CEP) credit points are required for RPO re-recognition?
options: 10 credit points per year.
Not specifically stated in LEM/TEK/18 Sem.3 but referenced in another document (LEM/TEK/44).
30 credit points throughout the recognition period.
No credit points required.
answer: Not specifically stated in LEM/TEK/18 Sem.3 but referenced in another document (LEM/TEK/44).

question: What must the RPO do with radiation equipment that is no longer in use?
options: Only store it in the storage area.
Ensure it is disposed of or transferred according to the procedures established by AELB.
Sold to another company without AELB's knowledge.
Labelled as non-functional and left alone.
answer: Ensure it is disposed of or transferred according to the procedures established by AELB.

question: Who must be appointed as the Chairman of the Radiation Protection Committee (JPS), if established?
options: Radiation Protection Officer (RPO).
The License Holder.
A Senior Manager appointed by the License Holder.
Any JPS member with the highest qualification.
answer: A Senior Manager appointed by the License Holder.
